org.jcvi.jillion.core.qual

Class PhredQuality

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.core.qual.PhredQuality
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<PhredQuality>

    public final class PhredQuality
extends Object
implements Comparable<PhredQuality>
    PhredQuality is a representation of a Phred quality score.

    PhredQuality uses the flyweight pattern to reuse the same objects for the same quality score.

    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte MAX_VALUE
      Max allowed Phred Quality score, currently set to 127.
      static byte MIN_VALUE
      Minimum allowd Phred Quality score, currently set to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(PhredQuality other)
        Compares this quality value to the given quality.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<PhredQuality>
        Parameters:
        other - the other quality value.
        Returns:
        A negative number if this quality is less than the other quality, 0 if the two qualities are equal, and a positive value if this quality value is greater than the other quality.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(double qualityValue)
        Compares this quality value to the given quality value as a double.
        Implementation Requirements:
        this is the functionally the same as compareTo(PhredQuality.valueOf(qualityValue)) but should be computed faster since there is no creation of an extra PhredQuality object.
        Parameters:
        qualityValue - the other quality value to compare to. Note: no boundary checks are done to make sure that the other quality value is a value in the valid PhredQuality range.
        Returns:
        A negative number if this quality is less than the other quality, 0 if the two qualities are equal, and a positive value if this quality value is greater than the other quality.
        Since:
        5.2

      • withErrorProbability

        public static PhredQuality withErrorProbability(double errorProbability)
        Get the PhredQuality with the given associated error probability.
        Parameters:
        errorProbability - a double between 0 and 1 exclusive
        Returns:
        a PhredQuality instance, never null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given probability is not between 0 and 1 exclusive

      • computeQualityScore

        public static int computeQualityScore(double errorProbability)
        Get the quality score with the given associated error probability.
        Parameters:
        errorProbability - a double between 0 and 1 exclusive
        Returns:
        an int instance, never negative
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given probability is not between 0 and 1 exclusive

      • getErrorProbability

        public double getErrorProbability()
        Get the error probability that a basecall of this phred value is incorrectly called.
        Returns:
        10^(-q/10)

      • getQualityScore

        public byte getQualityScore()
        Get this PhredQuality's quality score as a byte.
        Returns:
        a positive byte value.

      • valueOf

        public static PhredQuality valueOf(int qualityScore)
        Get the corresponding PhredQuality instance with the given quality score.
        Parameters:
        qualityScore - the quality score
        Returns:
        the PhredQuality instance that represents the given qualityScore.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if qualityScore < 0 or > Byte.MAX_VALUE.

        Create an array of bytes which correspond to the input QualitySequence.
        Parameters:
        qualities - a QualitySequence.
        Returns:
        a new byte array, never null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if qualities are null

      • toString

        public static String toString(byte qualityValue)
        Returns same String value as PhredQuality.valueOf(qualityValue).toString() but without the overhead of object construction.
        Parameters:
        qualityValue - the quality value to print.
        Returns:
        a String will never be null.
        Throws:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Two PhredQuality values are equal if and only if they both have the same quality score.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Returns:
        true if the given PhredQuality has the same quality score as this; false otherwise.
